VI.iii.1.C.8.c
.
Adjusting an Award When an Incarcerated Child Who is Not Legally in the Surviving Spouse’s Custody Is Released
If the incarcerated child is released and legally out of the surviving spouse’s custody,
adjust the apportioned awards of any other children, and
resume the payment of benefits, provided all eligibility factors are met.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C - Incarceration of Dependents and Certain Survivors
citation: Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C
